news.title: Netflix to buy Warner Bros. film and streaming assets in $72 billion deal
news.summary: Netflix announced it's reached a deal to buy WBD. The bidding process also involved Paramount Skydance and Comcast. The deal is expected to close in the next few weeks.

news.title: $208 million wiped out: Yieldstreet investors rack up more losses as firm rebrands to Willow Wealth
news.summary: Yieldstreet is attempting to move past a troubled track record by rebranding to Willow Wealth. Customers reel from a still-unfolding collapse of its funds.

news.title: Southwest Airlines cuts outlook on government shutdown demand hit, higher fuel costs
news.summary: The carrier said it expects 2025 earnings before interest and taxes of about $500 million. That's down from a previous forecast of $600 million to $800 million.

news.title: Putin says Russia is willing to supply 'uninterrupted' fuel to India, as U.S. pressures New Delhi to cut back
news.summary: Russian oil exports have declined owing to U.S. sanctions. Rosneft and Lukoil are two of Russia's largest oil companies.

news.title: Apple announces departure of general counsel and policy chief
news.summary: The two executives reported to Apple CEO Tim Cook. They are the latest members of senior leadership to exit the iPhone maker. The two executives are believed to be leaving the company in the coming months.

news.title: Netflix set to transform media business — and itself — with $83 billion Warner Bros. deal
news.summary: Netflix will become a vastly bigger and different company once its deal to acquire Warner Bros. and Discovery’s studio and streaming businesses goes through.

news.title: Wegovy’s prices are going down, but they are ‘wildly different’
news.summary: How much Novo Nordisk’s weight-loss drug Wegovy costs can depend on a lot of things, which makes it very hard for the average person to understand.

news.title: The one thing people are still buying? Beauty products, and Ulta just proved it.
news.summary: “Masstige’ is winning even as consumers cut costs elsewhere. “Mas stige” is winning in the U.S. even as other companies cut costs.

news.title: Why ‘buy the dip’ is not that great a strategy — and what works better, according to this quant firm.
news.summary: Researchers at AQR tested out buy-the-dip as an investing strategy and were not impressed. They found it to be a waste of money.

news.title: ‘Misbehaving’ U.S. long bonds have this strategist looking for yield elsewhere
news.summary: When Greenspan and Bernanke were hiking rates, long-term yields kept falling. Now Powell is cutting, the reverse is happening — a conundrum for HSBC's strategist.
